channel.title: Perl Weekly newsletter
channel.description: A free, once a week e-mail round-up of hand-picked news and articles about Perl.

item.title: Sprechen Sie Deutsch und Perl flieÃŸend? MÃ¶chten Sie in London leben?
item.description: Do you speak German, Perl, and passable English? My London-based client is interested in native (or near-native) German speakers who are interested in relocating to London (to join an English-speaking team). While the majority of projects are undertaken in English, the client has projects where some German would be helpful.

item.title: Polyglot required Down Under â€“ Senior Developer role in Melbourne, Australia
item.description: Gâ€™day, Perl Mongers of Australia! Do you have a strong background in Perl, but a desire to learn and apply other languages? This client is looking for a polyglot developer, with a focus on Perl but potential to also use (and be cross-trained in) Scala, Ruby, Python and JavaScript. It is a small, flexible team and there may be the opportunity to undertake some DevOps work too if interested.

item.title: Perhaps the most enlightened Perl team in London
item.description: If you want to be using the absolute best in tooling, do Modern Perl properly, and benefit from working with one of the most switched-on and enlightened Perl teams in London â€” and you donâ€™t mind commuting to Chiswick â€” youâ€™d struggle to do better than this team.

item.title: Largest Perl team in London with beautiful Docklands offices
item.description: Large, dynamic Perl team in Canary Wharf looking for mid-level and senior developers. Run by a Perl-loving CTO in beautiful offices with a great view over Canary Wharf, the company manages one legacy Perl codebase and a whole bunch of very new, very shiny, and very modern codebases that power the market-leading solution in their particular area. Free breakfast, too, for some values of breakfast.

item.title: Interactive Television with Perl - North West England with an international reach
item.description: nterested in working at the cutting edge of broadcast and interactive TV technology? Know how to put together Perl-based APIs using DBIx::Class and Moose? The team uses Modern Perl, and is looking for 2+ years of experience, hopefully encompassing Moose or Moo, Test::Builder-based testing tools, one of the major web frameworks (with bonus points for an understanding of PSGI/Plack) and familiarity

item.title: SPVM 1.0 language specification
item.description: Yuki-san shares SPVM 1.0 specification. Most of the specification is written in Japanese. SPVM is a programming language which can be used as CPAN module.

item.title: Perl v5.28.2
item.description: Steve Hay has released Perl 5.28.2, a production release. It represents 4 months of development and contains approximately 1,200 lines of changes to 29 files. It includes bug fixes and a few core module updates.

item.title: Make what matters stick! StickerYou has an exclusive discount for all Perl Weekly subscribers
item.description: Need to brand everything with stickers, even your personal hydration bottle and coffee mug? At StickerYou.com you can create premium waterproof stickers in any size, shape, and order quantity. Whether youâ€™re a freelancer or aspiring entrepreneur, StickerYou makes it easy for you to stick your logo on everything and create brand awareness, or just to make stickers for personal expression, whether humorous or to support a cause. Use code PERL10 at checkout for a 10% discount on your order.

item.title: #404 - White Camel Awards 2018
item.description:
Hi there

Recently the White Camel Awards 2018 were annouced and awarded to three very popular names. In category "Perl Community", Todd Rinaldo was choosen for his help to organize Perl conferences and hackathons and provided other support through one of Perl's largest financial contributors, cPanel. For "Perl Advocacy", David Farrell was the winner for PerlTricks and Perl.com. Last but not the least, in the category "Perl User Groups", Max Maischein was picked as winner. Max Maischein has been Frakfurt.pm's treasurer since 2011, handling the accounting, reporting, and contracting, as well as coordinating work with other local organizations. Without that important work nothing could get done. He's part of the backbone of the German Perl community.

Congratulations to all three winners from the team of PerlWeekly newsletter.

Have a great week ahead and enjoy the sun.
